title: Do we control technology or does technology control us? - Quora

response.answer_text: I will suggest a better alternate question first :- “What happens when technology knows more about us than we do ? “ We all know Technology has become incredibly intelligent and already knows a lot about our internal states. A computer now can detect our slightest facial micro expressions and be able to tell the difference between a real smile and a fake one. This is only the beginning. I think. And whether we like it or not , we already are sharing parts of our inner lives that's out of our control. This seems like a problem, because a lot of us like to keep what's going on inside from what people actually see. I think we want a agency over what we share and what we don't. I really get goosebumps when i think , what will happen when A.I will become self-aware. I think slavery will hit mankind once again and this time we created our slavery gods.

Mastering technology is using the right tools for the best job and also developing additional tools to quicken your work. So as said above, I will say technology has mastered in the sense that once we know what we up to, technology with the current insertion of AI and other systems, it knows what we really want to achieve. Let me use WordPress as example. A developer might decide to use WordPress to complete a neat project within a day or two. Now time not wasted because once he drags anything to add to the project; WordPress knows what he might want to do next, else he decided to change the more of operation of that very Item added. In short technology is mastering us in knowing what we do daily

Definitely we do. YOU might have heard about a line Technology has 0 (zero) IQ. Everything the technology does is our commands and our implementation of knowledge and logics. Though we made the technology and it's arms. If we made its mind to use the arm in some awkward way it would surely affect us. You have thousands of examples in support to this. Thanks . Keep reading !

Both. For any given technology there are people who are comfortable and fluent in its use, and people who are totally baffled or downright hostile. The ratio varies according to the familiarity and complexity of the technology. For instance, I’m fine with the flush toilet but bitcoin, not so much.

Either/or questions like this one almost always miss the mark. There are other options, in this case obviously that they are interactive. It doesn’t make much sense to ask “do cooking recipes control us or do we control cooking recipes? It goes both ways. Those who invent technologies control them; those who are slaves to their cell phones are controlled by them.

Thats entirely a matter of choice. We develop technology towards assisting us, enhancing our lives, making our situations better. Worshipping or allowing domination by technology is what we would choose for ourselves.Choosing to use it objectively and pragmatically towards our benefit is another choice.
Do we control technology or does technology control us? That is the question that will be answered in a few decades or sooner. It is this I’m concerned about for humanity sake.
It depends on how you interact with it. Here's more info about this: Technology: Do You Control It, Or Does It Control You?
